page.title: 08A DAY AT THE PEATS
page.content: At the first sign of good weather in the Spring,lots of people in our village set off to the peat bogs.Each family has their own peat bank.The first thing to be done is the 'turfing'-taking the top off the peat,which has grown a grassy layer. Now the peats are cut with a peat-iron.As they are sliced,some-one has to be down in the peat bog catching them and putting them at the side of the bank.It is very sore on the back! Next they have to be spread out to dry.Later they are piled up into high stacks.Once they are ready,they are collected in bags or by tractor and taken home to be used for fuel.Peat fires give off a very distinctive smell.
